intro: Tetranthera pallida, commonly known as the pale tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a smooth, glossy surface. Tetranthera pallida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
